Indian Economy.title: TCA Anant: Misconceptions mustn’t prevail over the reality of India’s GDP estimates
Indian Economy.summary: Talk of ‘statistical mysteries’ should not distract us. Indian statistics are robust and a low GDP deflator, as seen in data for the first quarter of 2025-26, has a clear explanation. Here’s a closer look at how the economy’s growth estimates are made.

Indian Economy.title: India's tax reforms to partially offset tariff hit on GDP growth: CEA
Indian Economy.summary: The net impact of higher tariffs and lower domestic taxes will be a drop of 0.2%-0.3% points on GDP growth estimates for the year, says Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran

Indian Economy.title: GST rate cut may limit tariff impact on GDP to 0.2–0.3%: CEA Nageswaran
Indian Economy.summary: Anantha Nageswaran stressed that agriculture reforms are critical, as empowering farmers with market freedom could add 0.5–0.7% to India’s GDP growth

Banking & Finance.title: Is it safe to take loans via mobile apps?
Banking & Finance.summary: Before you proceed, always read the app reviews and ratings. Responsible lenders will always run proper KYC checks, evaluate your repayment ability, and be transparent about fees, charges, and penalties.
